intro: Vausagesia africana, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and woody, thorny stems. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible but have a bitter taste. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Vausagesia africana is adapted to withstand drought and has a slow growth rate.
